We are going to put our money where our mouths are with the$ 5 million recording contract, executive producer Simon Cowell said in a statement. World, who resigned from the paper when Goodwin and Glenn Mulcaire were convicted in 2007. Andy Coulson has always claimed he knew nothing about the hacking but last week he quit as David Cameron 's communications chief, saying when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on. Even with the number of suspects and alleged victims growing, many doubt the scandal will change Britain's keenly competitive tabloid culture. Newspapers believe readers are hungry for scoops-- and will forgive tabloids their transgressions
